clues.text: This Oregon city of 503,000 has held its annual Rose Festival since 1907

It's not a rose's pelvis, it's a rose's fruit that's rich in vitamin C
Chosen the most popular rose at the 2000 World Rose Convention it bears the name of a Swedish 3-time Oscar winner

People had thought that hippos sweated this, but it's just an oily red liquid
A beloved 8-inch ceramic hippo named William lives in the Egyptian galleries of this NYC art museum
They are the 2 plural forms of the word hippopotamus
Some believe this big biblical term, Hebrew for "beast", referred to the hippo
Layer of soil just above the subsoil
A cover crop isn't an FBI plant, it's there to prevent this
5-letter term for a bound bundle of wheat

The "henge" part of the word Stonehenge is a term meaning an ancient monument arranged in this shape
One legend says that this magician who helped King Arthur used his powers to build Stonehenge
Today some archaeologists believe that Stonehenge was used to track & observe these 2 heavenly bodies
During the summer solstice, modern-day people who act like these Celtic priests hold cermonies at Stonehenge

clues.text: "Maximus Decimus Meridius... father to a murdered son, husband to a murdered wife, and I will have my vengeance"

"I remember every detail.  The Germans wore gray, you wore blue"
"I tell you things, you tell me things, not about this case, though, about yourself. Quid pro quo... yes or no, Clarice?"
